greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Aliquot sequence starting at 180.
comment: The sum-of-divisor function A000203 and aliquot parts A001065 are defined only for positive integers, so the trajectory ends when 0 is reached, here at index 52. - _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 24 2018
reference: R. K. Guy, Unsolved Problems in Number Theory, B6.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..52
Index entries for sequences related to aliquot parts.
maple: f := proc(n) option remember; if n = 0 then 180; else sigma(f(n-1))-f(n-1); fi; end:
xref: Cf. A008885 (starting at 30), ..., A008892 (starting at 276), A098007 (length of aliquot sequences).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
